definition:
We are said to be using if we write functions to the right of their
arguments. That is, if $\alpha : X \to Y$ is a function and $x \in X$,
then $x \alpha$ is the image of $x$ under $\alpha$.

Furthermore, if we have a function $\beta : Y \to Z$, then we write the
composition of the two functions as $\alpha \beta : X \to Z$, and the
image of $x$ under the composition as
$x \alpha \beta = x (\alpha \beta) = (x \alpha) \beta$.

Compare this to left function notation.
